messages.text:
LGTM.

is this level of consistency truly necessary?

On 2012/10/31 12:45:08, minux wrote:
> ...
> is this level of consistency truly necessary?

I was looking at build output the other day:

# ..\misc\dashboard\builder ..\misc\goplay

# ..\test\bench\go1
ok      _/C_/go/root/test/bench/go1     5.156s

# ..\misc\cgo\life

# ..\misc\cgo\stdio

# ..\misc\cgo\test
ok      _/C_/go/root/misc/cgo/test      1.172s

# ..\doc\progs

# test

# Checking API compatibility.
# ...

and wandering which test the "# test" refers to. I thought, making it say "# ..\test" (like all others do), should avoid such confusion in the future.

Sorry for the noise.

Alex

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=5bc48b616305 ***

run.bat: make output consistent

R=golang-dev, minux.ma
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6811059

subject: code review 6811059: run.bat: make output consistent
